Some time ago, a website talked about the risks of sharing our whereabouts online. The website said that when we post where we are, we're not just telling our friends, but also strangers. This made people realize that there might be a downside to sharing everything on the internet.
We can share many things online, like photos and stories, and it can be exciting. But sometimes we realize that we're not alone and that what we share can affect others. Some people have already learned this the hard way.
In the early days of the internet, some pioneers started sharing their lives online. They shared their thoughts, photos, and stories, and people started reading and talking about them. One of these pioneers was a 19-year-old student named Justin Hall. He started posting on the internet in 1994 and shared his life, including his thoughts and feelings.
Justin's website was popular, but he also faced problems. One day, he wrote about a romantic relationship, and his partner didn't like it. They asked him to stop writing about their relationship, or they would end the relationship. Justin stopped writing about his personal life, but the problem is still there.
Another example is Heather Armstrong, a young woman who worked in a software company. She wrote about her job on her blog, but an anonymous colleague sent her blog to her bosses, and she lost her job.
These stories show that what we share online can affect our real lives. We need to think carefully about what we share and how it might affect others.

'A while ago, some scientists started talking about a low-budget film called What the Bleep Do We Know? The film shows that there's a lot we don't understand about the universe. Most scientists agree with this, but some were worried about the film's claims. They thought it was important to warn people about the film's ideas. 
At first, I didn't see what all the fuss was about. Scientists were talking about new discoveries that showed the universe is stranger than we thought. But then I started to understand what all the fuss was about. They were talking about discoveries like how water molecules can be affected by our thoughts. This was amazing! 
Some people think this is true because it's easy to understand and looks impressive. But scientists are more critical. They want more proof before they believe something. The film didn't give enough evidence, just some pretty pictures. 
The truth is that scientists are still discovering new things about the universe. They have found out that the universe is made of unknown matter and is being pushed by a mysterious force called dark energy. They have also found out that our brains can't keep up with what's happening around us, and that our brains edit out things we don't notice. 
We are still far from knowing everything. In fact, many things can't be fully understood. Scientists are trying to find a way to explain everything in one equation, but it's a big challenge. Some people think the universe is just incredible.'

Writing novels is a big challenge for me, but writing short stories is a joy. Writing novels is like planting a forest, while writing short stories is like planting a garden. Both processes are important and help me become a better writer. When I finish a novel, I usually want to write some short stories. When I finish a group of short stories, I want to start a new novel. I never write short stories while I'm writing a novel, and never write a novel while I'm working on short stories.
I started writing short stories in 1984. At first, it was difficult for me, but I enjoyed the experience. I felt like I could explore new ideas and worlds. My readers seemed to like my short stories too. One of my early short stories, 'Breaking Waves', was included in my first collection of short stories.
I like writing short stories because they don't take as long to finish. It usually takes me about a week to write a short story. Writing a novel can take a long time, sometimes a year or two. Writing short stories is a change of pace for me. I can write about small things, like an idea or a word, and see where it takes me. If an idea doesn't work out, I don't worry about it. I can try again. Writing short stories helps me learn and improve my writing. It's like an experiment for me. Without short stories, I wouldn't be able to experiment and try new things in my novels.
My short stories are like memories for me. I remember exactly where I wrote each one and how I felt. They are like a map to my heart. I'm happy to share these feelings with my readers.

Science is a complex subject that touches on philosophy and has a big impact on our daily lives. It helps us understand the world around us and has the power to cure diseases. However, it is not perfect and has its limitations. Scientists are people who try to understand the world, but they can make mistakes. The history of science is full of disagreements and conflicts. New ideas often challenge old ones, and it's not always easy to accept change.
This book looks at some of the most important ideas in science that have changed the way we think about the world. We will explore these ideas and look at their beauty and limitations. We will also consider how they have affected our lives and the world around us.
Science is always changing, and scientists are always finding new ways to explain the world. Sometimes these new ideas are big and change our understanding of the world completely. Other times, they are small and build on what we already know. Either way, science is an important part of our lives, and we need to understand it to make good decisions about our future.
In the past, science was mostly about observing the natural world. Now, we are starting to control it and make changes to the world around us. This gives us a lot of power, but it also means we have to be careful and think about the consequences of our actions. We can no longer just ignore science and hope it will go away. It's part of our future, and we need to be involved in shaping it.

'For a few years, book sales were growing. But then, some big publishers started to say that ebook sales were not growing anymore. In fact, some were even going down. This made people wonder if ebooks would replace print books. One person in the publishing industry said that the excitement about ebooks might have led to bad investments. He thought that people were too confident in the power of ebooks.
But the question remains: will ebooks replace print books? Some people think so, but others don't. The truth is that both ebooks and print books can coexist. The idea that ebooks will replace print books is an old one. Even before ebooks, people thought that new technologies would replace old ones. For example, when TV was invented, people thought radio would disappear. But radio survived by finding new uses.
The idea that ebooks will replace print books is not new. People have been saying this since the 1800s, when the phonograph was invented. They thought books would be replaced by audiobooks. This has happened many times before. New technologies have always seemed to threaten old ones, but they usually find a way to coexist.
We create emotional bonds with different media, like books, TVs, and computers. When a new technology comes along, we have to adjust to it. This can make us nostalgic for what we used to have. That's why we often see a demand for older technologies, like vinyl records or film cameras.
The spread of ebooks has made people appreciate print books more. They like the feel and smell of physical books. This should be reassuring for those who worry about the future of print books. However, the idea that ebooks will replace print books will continue to be a popular story. It's a way to talk about the power of technology and our fear of change.'

'For a year and a half, I wrote about how famous people from the past four hundred years managed their daily routines to be creative and productive. I looked at what they did every day, including when they slept, ate, worked, and worried. By doing this, I hoped to learn more about their personalities and careers.
I believe that knowing someone's daily routine can tell you a lot about them. For example, what they eat and when they take a nap can say a lot about their character. In this book, I focus on the daily routines of creative people, not just their finished work. I want to show how their daily habits influenced their work and vice versa.
The book's title is Daily Rituals, but I'm really interested in people's routines. A routine can be ordinary, but it can also be a way to make the most of our limited time, energy, and willpower. A good routine can help us stay focused and avoid feeling overwhelmed.
I started this project because I was struggling to manage my own time and energy. One day, I was supposed to write an article, but instead, I spent the day tidying my office and making coffee. I then started looking at how other writers organized their days and found it interesting. This inspired me to collect these stories and share them with others. The book is a collection of daily routines from famous people, with quotes and summaries from their writings and interviews. I hope it will help readers learn more about how to manage their time and stay creative.'

Howard became a palaeontologist because of a change in his family's plans when he was six years old. His father, a careful person, had to cancel their holiday to Spain due to high interest rates. Instead, they rented a chalet by the English coast. On a rainy August afternoon, Howard found an ammonite on the beach. This experience made him want to become a palaeontologist. He decided to focus on the early days of life on Earth. He didn't like the big, well-known dinosaurs; he was more interested in the small, ancient creatures that lived on rocks.
After finishing university, Howard wasn't sure if he would get a job. He knew he was good at his work, but he also knew that it's not always fair. He applied for a job at Tavistock College in London, but he didn't have high hopes. On the day of the interview, the professor who was supposed to chair the panel had an argument with his wife and was late. Another professor took his place, and Howard got the job. Howard was surprised and grateful, but later found out that the professor had helped him because he didn't like the other candidate.
Howard was happy to have the job and could finally do the work he loved. He often compared his professional life, where he could plan and work, to his personal life, where things didn't always go as planned. One day, someone stole his briefcase with his notes for a lecture. He was angry and had to postpone the lecture. Later, he met a colleague who was with a curator from the Natural History Museum in Nairobi. The curator told him about a new collection of fossils that needed to be studied. Howard was excited and decided to go to Nairobi to study the fossils. He cancelled his other plans and found a way to go to the museum.

Charles Spence is a professor of psychology at Oxford University. He studies how our senses work together to create the taste of food. He has found that many things can affect how we taste food, such as who we eat with, how the food is presented, and even the background noise.
Spence has written a book about his research, called The Perfect Meal. He has also worked with famous chefs and food companies to help them create better-tasting food. For example, he has helped a company reduce the amount of salt and sugar in their products.
Spence has also worked with a famous chef named Heston Blumenthal to create special dishes that use sound to enhance the flavor of food. For example, they created a dish called "Sound of the Sea" that uses the sound of the sea to make the food taste more like the sea.
Spence's research has shown that many things can affect how we taste food, including the shape of the plate, the color of the food, and even the music we listen to. He has also found that some sounds can make food taste better, such as higher-pitched music, while others can make it taste worse, such as lower-pitched and brassy sounds.
In his free time, Spence enjoys eating and trying new foods with his family. He has even had dinner parties where they use special equipment to test how different sounds and lights can affect the taste of food.

Our brains are working harder than ever. We're bombarded with information, fake news, and rumors, all pretending to be true. We need to sort through this information to find what's important and what we can ignore. At the same time, we're doing more tasks on our own. Thirty years ago, travel agents booked our flights and salespeople helped us find what we needed. Now we do most things ourselves. We're doing the work of 10 people, but still trying to keep up with our lives, families, work, hobbies, and favorite TV shows. Our smartphones help us do all this, but they also make us want to cram as much as possible into every spare moment.
However, research shows that our brains are not good at multitasking. We think we're doing several things at once, but really we're just switching between tasks quickly. This takes a lot of mental effort. Multitasking makes us less efficient and can even make us stressed. It's like trying to juggle many balls at once - we might think we're doing well, but we're actually just switching between balls quickly.
Our brains are wired to focus on one thing at a time. When we try to do many things at once, we're not using our brains effectively. In fact, multitasking can make us less smart and more likely to make mistakes. It's like trying to learn new things while watching TV - the information goes to the wrong part of our brain, making it harder to understand.
We also make many small decisions every day, like answering emails or texts. These decisions take up a lot of mental energy, and after a while, we can get tired and make bad decisions. Many business leaders, scientists, and writers agree that email is a big problem. It's not the email itself, but the huge amount of communication we receive that's the issue.

In caves in the US, female bats help other bats that are having trouble giving birth. Are they being kind? Fifty years ago, people thought animals just behaved in certain ways and that was it. They didn't think about whether animals felt emotions or had moral rules. But now, scientists are starting to study animal emotions and moral rules. They are even writing books about it, like "Wild Justice" and "Do Fish Feel Pain?". This has started a big debate: can animals really think and feel like we do? This debate also makes us think about whether animals have a sense of right and wrong. In one experiment, cows had to open a gate to get food. The cows that opened the gate themselves seemed happier than those that didn't. If cows like solving problems, what does this mean for eating beef? Some people think it means we should stop eating meat. Others think we should just learn more about animal thinking. There are different opinions on this topic, and it's hard to know what to think.

'Thinking critically is a way to understand what we read or hear more deeply. Adrian West, a researcher at the Edward de Bono Foundation in the UK, believes that argument is a way to find the truth. However, he also thinks that technology is changing the way we approach complex problems. We are exposed to a lot of information, but it's not always good quality. This can make it hard for us to think clearly.
West says that the amount of information we have doesn't necessarily mean we are more knowledgeable or make better decisions. In fact, he thinks that the quality of our thinking hasn't improved much.
The National Endowment for the Arts says that people are reading less, and this might be because of the rise of visual media. Patricia Greenfield, a psychologist, thinks that this could be a problem. She says that when we focus on visual media, we don't develop our critical thinking skills as much.
Greenfield has studied how technology affects learning and found that it can have both positive and negative effects. For example, a computer game might help us think critically or make it worse. Reading on the internet can help us analyze information, but clicking on lots of links can make it hard to think deeply.
Greenfield says that technology changes the way we think, and this is a problem. She thinks that reading is better for our brains than watching TV or playing video games. Reading helps us use our imagination and think critically.
However, some people think that video games can be good for our brains too. James Paul Gee, a professor of educational psychology, says that video games can help us learn and think critically. He thinks that games like Sim City and Civilization can teach us important skills like decision-making and analysis.
In the end, it's clear that technology is changing the way we think, and we need to understand how it affects us.'

Matthew Crawford is a motorcycle mechanic who also writes about how to live a good life. His latest book is about how to deal with modern technology and how it affects our lives. He was inspired to write it when he noticed that advertisements started appearing on his credit card machine while he was waiting for his transaction to process. He realized that we are constantly being distracted by things like advertisements and social media, and that it's hard to focus on what's really important.
Crawford thinks that this is a problem because it's making us lose touch with the world around us. We're spending more time looking at screens and less time talking to each other. He says that we're becoming more like machines, reacting to stimuli without really thinking about what's happening.
He believes that we need to find ways to be more present in the world, to engage with real things and people, rather than just representations of them. He gives examples of people who do this, like chefs, hockey players, and motorbike racers, who have to use their skills and judgment to work with real things.
Crawford thinks that we should find ways to use our judgment and pay attention to what's really important. This can be hard, but it's worth it because it makes us more focused and able to connect with others.

'What do you do for a living?' is a common question. But when someone says they are a philosopher, it can be difficult to answer. This is because people often think that philosophers are special or have some kind of special knowledge. But philosophers are just like everyone else. They study and think about big questions.
A long time ago, the Greek philosopher Aristotle said that a life of thinking and learning was the best kind of life. Many people still think this today. Another Greek philosopher, Socrates, said that a life without thinking and questioning is not worth living. This means that we should always think about our actions and decisions.
But philosophy doesn't have to be complicated or only for experts. It's about thinking about our daily lives and making sure they are what we want them to be. It's not about being a special person, but about being thoughtful and aware.
Unfortunately, philosophy has become less connected to everyday life. Many philosophers work in universities and write books that only other experts can understand. This makes it hard for ordinary people to understand philosophy. But this doesn't have to be the case. Philosophy can help us think about our lives and make better decisions.
I am a philosopher and my work is mostly about ethics, which is the study of what is right and wrong. But I think there's more to philosophy than just deciding what is right or wrong. Philosophy can help us think about our values and attitudes, and how they affect our lives.
By thinking about these things, we can learn more about ourselves and the world around us. We might even discover that our beliefs are not as clear-cut as we thought. But this is okay, because thinking and questioning is what makes us human.'

'Eating is a big part of our lives, and many people think that thinking deeply about food can make it even more enjoyable. However, philosophers haven't always talked about food in a serious way. Instead, they have used food as a metaphor for other ideas, like learning. Some philosophers, like Epicurus, believed that pleasure and avoiding pain are important, but they didn't just mean eating and drinking. Today, the name Epicurus is often used to sell food and drink products.
Food is also a social and cultural thing. The food we eat comes from our communities and is often shared with others. This is why food is an important topic for philosophers to explore.
Food critics write about what they think of different foods, but some people think that tasting food is not a special skill. Instead, they think that good food critics are just better at describing what they taste.
Food can also be beautiful, like a work of art. Some people think that food should be considered beautiful, but others disagree because food is meant to be eaten and then gone.
There are also many ethical questions about food, such as what we should eat and why. Philosophers can help us think about these questions and come up with answers.
Cooking at home is different from cooking in a restaurant. When we cook at home, we often cook for people we love and care about. In a restaurant, the chefs have to cook for many people and make sure the food is good, but they don't have the same personal relationships with the people they cook for.
Food can also help us understand and connect with people from other cultures. For example, we can learn to appreciate their food and customs, and this can help us build friendships and bridges between cultures.'

Rob Daviau, an American game designer, created a new type of board game called 'legacy games'. He wanted to make games more exciting and challenging. He took an old game called Risk and changed it so that players' decisions had a lasting impact. For example, players might have to tear up cards or damage the board. The game is played over several sessions, and players can see how their choices affect the game.
Daviau worked on another game called Pandemic, which is a cooperative game where players work together to stop diseases. He then created a new game called SeaFall, where players become sailors exploring the world.
Designing legacy games is complex because designers need to think about all the possible choices players can make and how they will affect the game. To test the games, designers play them with a group of people and see how they unfold.
Many people love legacy games because they feel like they are part of a bigger story. They like the idea of making choices that have a lasting impact. One player, Russell Chapman, said that legacy games are the biggest innovation in game design in years.
The idea of legacy games is not new, but it has become popular recently. The concept is similar to video games and TV shows, where each episode builds on the previous one. Daviau thinks that people will soon get bored with legacy games and want something new.
Colby Dauch, the manager of the company that published SeaFall, thinks that legacy games are revolutionary and change the way we think about board games.

'One night, an octopus named Inky escaped from his tank at a New Zealand aquarium. He climbed out of the tank, crawled across the floor, and slipped into a drain that led to the ocean. This is a story that many people found exciting and funny.
People often imagine that animals are like us, and this is especially true for octopuses. They are very smart and can do many things that we can't, like opening jars or recognizing faces. But Dr. Frans de Waal, a scientist who studies primates, says that we often don't give animals enough credit for their intelligence. He thinks that we should recognize that animals are capable of many things that we thought were unique to humans.
Dr. de Waal has studied animals for many years and has found that they are much smarter than we thought. They can think about the past and the future, feel empathy, and understand what others are thinking. In fact, animals are very similar to humans in many ways.
In the past, people thought that animals were not very smart and could not do many things. But this was not always the case. In the past, people believed that animals were intelligent and could even be put on trial for crimes. Charles Darwin, a famous scientist, also believed that animals were intelligent and could think like humans.
In the 20th century, scientists started to think that animals were just machines that reacted to stimuli, rather than thinking beings. This changed the way people thought about animals and how they treated them. But now, Dr. de Waal thinks that we are starting to realize that animals are intelligent and deserve our respect.
He believes that we should design tests that take into account the special abilities of each animal species. For example, squirrels are very good at remembering where they hide their food, while humans need apps to find their phones.
The story of Inky the octopus is a good example of how animals can amaze us. But Dr. de Waal thinks that we should be careful not to exaggerate the intelligence of animals. He believes that animals are capable of many amazing things, but we should not assume that they are as smart as humans.
The story of Inky has also shown us how important it is to appreciate the intelligence of animals. Dr. de Waal has run experiments to show how animals think and feel, and he believes that these findings can help us understand ourselves better.'

'Robotics is a new technology that is changing the way we work. It's like a revolution in the way we do things. Robots are already being used in factories and car production, but soon they will be used in many other areas too. Many people think that robots will take over most of the jobs that humans do, but they also think that their own jobs will stay the same. However, this is not true. Robots will change many jobs, including those in supermarkets and construction. For example, a robot can lay 1,000 bricks in one hour, which would take two human bricklayers a long time to do.
Some people think that robots will create new jobs for technicians and programmers, but others worry that robots will take away the human touch and make work less personal. Dr. Jing Bing Zhang, an expert on robotics, says that robots will change the way we work and that people will need to adapt to these changes. He thinks that people should learn new skills to stay ahead in the job market.
Robots are getting smarter and more efficient, and soon they will be able to work with other robots and humans. Many companies will need experts to manage their robots, and governments will need to make laws to protect us from the risks of robots. Robots will also change the way we live at home, with robots that can move around and interact with us in new ways.
This change brings both opportunities and challenges. Companies that adapt to the change will be successful, but governments and individuals will need to make sure that everyone is safe and protected. We need more people to study science, technology, engineering, and maths (STEM) to be ready for the future.'

'Mountaineer George Mallory said, "Because it's there," when asked why he wanted to climb Mount Everest. People often wonder why someone would risk their life to climb a mountain. Some people might be inspired to take risks after hearing this answer. It's a reminder that sometimes people climb just for the fun of it.
A Bolivian writer, Tejada-Flores, wrote an essay called "Games that Climbers Play" in 1967. He identified seven different types of climbing, from climbing small rocks to climbing high mountains. He said that how you climb depends on the rules of the game.
Many people love climbing because it makes them feel free. However, climbing can also be very restrictive, like being stuck in a tent during a storm. There is a paradox in climbing - it can be both freeing and confining.
A US rock climber, Joe Fitschen, asks a different question: "Why do people climb?" He thinks that climbing is in our nature, and we climb because it's natural for us to take risks and challenge ourselves.
Another writer, Brian Treanor, thinks that climbing helps people develop good qualities like courage, humility, and respect for nature. Climbing can also help people develop these qualities in our modern world.
Some climbers believe that climbing on your own is more challenging and rewarding than climbing with others. This can lead to controversy, as some climbers might take unnecessary risks.
Climbing can also be a way to be in the moment, to focus on the present, and to solve problems in a natural way. This is similar to the techniques used in Zen philosophy to achieve inner peace. Climbers might find that climbing helps them feel more at peace.'

When I was little, I thought all gardens were beautiful and peaceful. My grandfather's garden was special. It was near a river and had a gentle slope towards the water. You couldn't reach the river, but you could hear the sound of the water and the birds singing in the trees. I imagined that all gardens were like this - a place to escape and be alone. My grandfather's garden wasn't special because of big things like a greenhouse. Some of his neighbors had greenhouses made from old window frames. My father, my grandfather's son, was a quiet person. He didn't talk much, but he liked to make me laugh. He had funny phrases, like "It's immaterial to me." He wasn't very ambitious and didn't have a big dream. He became a plumber, which wasn't his passion. He was good at fixing things around the house, like building bookshelves. My parents moved house only once, but my mother loved to buy new furniture. She would often surprise me with new chairs. One day, we got a piano, but I was too scared to play it. My sister had lessons, but I never got to play. My mother said I wouldn't practice. I loved the river and would often go there with a fishing net. I would walk along the riverbank, looking for a good spot to take off my shoes and go fishing. I wanted to get out of school, but it seemed impossible. But then my father told me about a job as an apprentice gardener in the Parks Department. I was excited. My father might not have wanted me to be a gardener, but I think he saw how much I loved it and wanted me to be happy.

Lawrence MacEwen lives on a small island called Muck, off the coast of Scotland. I visit him there. The weather is rough, with strong winds and rain. But MacEwen is comfortable on his island. He shows me around and tells me about the other islands nearby. He has a sheepdog named Tie, who helps him with his sheep. MacEwen has lived on the island for a long time, and his family has been there for over 3,000 years.
The island is a working farm, and MacEwen's family runs it together. His wife, Jenny, helps him with the farm work. Their children, Colin and Mary, manage the island's cottages and hotel, respectively. Mary's husband, Toby, loves that their two boys can explore the island and sail boats in the summer.
Life on the island can be challenging. There is no electricity all the time, and mobile phones don't work well. But the islanders are used to it. One day, a boat brings some groceries and three musicians who play music in the island's tearoom. The islanders enjoy the music.
MacEwen tells me how he met his wife, Jenny. Her father bought a farm on a nearby island without seeing it first, and Jenny was sent to manage it. She didn't know much about farming, but she had good typing skills.
I stay on the island for a while, eating delicious food and enjoying the scenery. I even go fishing with a local man named Sandy and bring back fresh fish for dinner. But eventually, it's time for me to leave the island and take a ferry to my next destination. I'm a bit sad to go, but I'm also excited to see what's next.

'The video game industry used to be hard to get into. Many people thought it was just for young people who liked playing games. But now, the industry is growing and taking itself seriously. It's still not easy, though. Making a game takes a lot of skill, hard work, and attention to detail. Jim Donelly, a spokesperson for a games magazine, says that it's hard to get a job at a big company, but there are still opportunities. He thinks the industry needs more game designers, not just people who make big decisions, but also those who design individual parts of a game.
So, how can you get into this competitive industry? Jim says that the most important thing is to make games. You need to have some experience making games to get a job. John Field, another expert, agrees that making games is important, but he also thinks that having a good education can help. He says that a postgraduate course in games can give you the skills and support you need to succeed.
Most game designers start by working as programmers or artists, and then move up to design games. They need to be interested in all kinds of entertainment and art, and have a passion for games. It can also help to have connections in the industry. John thinks that games are becoming more popular and will continue to grow. He believes that games can be a great way to learn new things and sees a lot of opportunities in the future.'

'I've always loved playing football. My dad encouraged me to play, but he didn't force me. I'm glad he didn't, because it made me enjoy it more. I had a friend who was pushed by his dad to play, but he stopped playing and never did it again. I'm lucky it wasn't like that for me. When I score a great goal, people say it's just luck, but I've worked hard to get good at it. Practice makes perfect. Even the best players in the world need to practice a lot to be good.
I used to play many sports at school, but football was my favourite. My teachers did a good job, but I didn't realize it at the time. Now I want my son to enjoy learning and playing sports too. We're already reading books to him, even though he's too young to sit still. I hope he doesn't want to kick the books around like I did!
When I started my professional football career, my manager gave us opportunities to play in the first team. He didn't make a big fuss about it, but we knew we had to work hard. We lost our first game, and a TV presenter said we couldn't win anything with young players. But we didn't listen to him. We believed in ourselves and worked together as a team.
I rely on my friends and family, but having a lot of money can be a problem. People sometimes think I'm too generous, but I like to help my family and friends. I've paid off my parents' mortgage and bought them a car. My mum loves her job as a hairdresser, and I don't want to make her stop. I have a lot of money, but it doesn't solve all my problems. After I stop playing football, I want to take a break and do things I haven't had time for before. I want to go skiing, but I can't do that now because I need to be careful not to get hurt and not be able to play football again.'

Here is the simplified text at the B1 level:
We moved to Reef Point because of Sam Carter, my father's agent in Los Angeles. He found a cheap place for us to live because my father couldn't write while we were in LA. The beach was usually empty because of the fog, but during the summer, it became popular. My father worked hard to write a script, but I often went to the beach with my dog Rusty. Rusty was a stray who liked to dig and bring me things he found. Sometimes, he would find things that didn't belong to him, like a new shoe or a beach towel. I would return these things to their owners.
My father thought Rusty was a nuisance, but I liked him. He loved the beach and swimming. He would always come with me when I went swimming, even though he couldn't swim as well as I could. After my father left to deliver the script to Los Angeles, Rusty and I spent the afternoon swimming and watching the surfers. One surfer caught my eye - she was very good. She asked me why I didn't join them, and I said I didn't have a surfboard. She suggested I could buy one, but I said I didn't have enough money. She asked if my father was American, and I said no, he was writing a script for a novel he had written. She knew the novel and asked if my father was Rufus Marsh. When I said yes, she looked at me with interest and asked about his book, "Tall as the Morning".

Violet Hetherington was standing in a long queue at the dock in Southampton. She was waiting to board the Queen Caroline, but the queue wasn't moving. Her friend Annie had told her to arrive late, but this time it seemed like a bad idea. Suddenly, an announcement came over the loudspeaker: the computer system had broken down. The atmosphere among the passengers became gloomy. Some people were frustrated, but Violet was worried. She had paid a lot of money for this trip and didn't want it to be ruined. She was also worried because she had left her phone at home. This meant she couldn't call the taxi company to check if she had left it there. 
As she stood in line, Violet met a friendly couple behind her. She asked to borrow their phone to call her son Harry, who could help her find her phone. She left a message asking her neighbor Kristina to check her flat to see if the phone was there. Violet was relieved that she wouldn't be in trouble, but she didn't tell Harry this. 
Finally, the queues started moving, and Violet went to the window to show her travel documents. She was disappointed when she saw the ship's foyer, which was not as luxurious as she had expected. The carpets and decorations looked like those in an airport. Violet took the elevator to the twelfth floor, where she finally had a room with a balcony, which was what she had wanted. She was relieved and happy that her worries were over.

When John Maloof bought a box of old photos, he didn't know he was getting a big surprise. He was looking for pictures to use in a book about a neighborhood in Chicago. Instead, he found 30,000 photos taken by a street photographer named Vivian Maier. Maloof was very surprised and happy to find such a big collection of her work.
Maier was a talented photographer who took many pictures of people, children, old people, and poor people. She loved taking pictures and didn't care if they were famous or not. Maloof has been studying her life and work and trying to learn more about her. He has many of her cameras, films, and prints, and even some old movies and audio recordings.
Maier was born in New York and grew up in France. She moved to Chicago and became a nanny. She always carried a camera with her and took pictures of everything she saw. People who knew her said she was a private person but loved taking pictures. She was very good at it and had a special way of seeing the world.
Now, Maloof and his friend are trying to tell the story of Vivian Maier's life and work. They want to make sure people know about her and her amazing photos.

Here is the simplified text for a learner of English at the B1 level:
Eleanor Catton is a young writer who has written a big and successful book called The Luminaries. She was born in New Zealand and now lives there. Her book is a murder mystery set in New Zealand in the 1860s. A group of 12 men are trying to solve a series of crimes. The story is very complex, with many characters and plot twists.
I interviewed Eleanor Catton when she was in the UK for a book promotion tour. She was very calm and friendly, despite being very busy. She told me a funny story about being stopped at the airport and asked to prove she was a writer. She showed the official her book and he asked what it was about.
Eleanor Catton wanted to write a murder mystery, but she found that the past offered many opportunities for complications and misunderstandings. Her book is over 800 pages long because she wanted to give each of the 20 main characters a good part. When I asked her how it feels to be so successful at such a young age, she said it was nice because everyone in her small country feels like they are part of her success.
Eleanor Catton also talked about the structure of her book. She wanted to write it in a spiral shape, with each part getting shorter. She said she didn't plan the book beforehand, but instead tried to write herself into a difficult situation and then find a way out. She also wanted to make the book fun for readers.
I asked her if she might want to write for TV or film, and she said it could be interesting. She loves watching TV dramas and thinks her book would work well on screen. She also talked about how her home country, New Zealand, inspires her writing. She likes the quiet and peaceful environment, which helps her to focus on her work.

Jonny Kinkead has been making guitars for over 40 years. As a boy, he loved playing guitar and building things with his dad's tools. He learned to play guitar when he was 11 and started making his own instruments when he was 16. Jonny's passion for guitar-making never went away. He loves how different types of wood can create different sounds.
Jonny didn't always plan to make guitars for a living. He studied architecture in university, but dropped out halfway through. He realized that building guitars was a way to combine his love of art and music. He started making guitars part-time and eventually turned it into a full-time job.
It wasn't easy for Jonny to become a successful guitar-maker. He had to work hard to get known and learn how to price his instruments. He believes that new guitar-makers can learn valuable skills in classes, but also need to try things out for themselves. Jonny thinks that the quality of UK-made guitars is now recognized and respected.

When talking about English conversations, it's common to start with the weather. This is because, as the famous writer Dr. Johnson said, "When two English people meet, their first topic of conversation is the weather." This is still true today. Many people try to explain why English people are so interested in the weather, but they often get it wrong. They think that English people are fascinated by the weather itself, but that's not the case.
In fact, English people don't really talk about the weather because they're interested in it. They talk about it because it's a way to start conversations and make small talk. It's like a code that helps people be friendly and polite. For example, saying "Nice day, isn't it?" or "It's cold today, isn't it?" isn't really about the weather at all. It's just a way to say hello or break the ice.
English people don't talk about the weather all the time. They only talk about it in certain situations, like when they meet someone new, when they're trying to start a conversation, or when they need to fill a silence. That's why it might seem like English people talk about the weather all the time, but really, it's just a way to be friendly and polite.

Here is the rewritten text, simplified for a learner of English at the B1 level:
Alice Leader stood in front of the remains of Hadrian's Wall in Britain. She was explaining to her students why it was an amazing achievement for the Romans to build something 120 km long and 5 meters high over 1,900 years ago. The students were interested, but they wanted to know why it was built. Alice didn't have a good answer, so she decided to write a book to help her explain it better.
After teaching for 31 years, Alice retired and started writing books. She wanted to write stories that would be interesting for children. She said, "Teaching is like acting. You have to perform every day. Writing is exciting, but it's not as tiring." Alice's friends who are also teachers are jealous of her because she gets to work with children through her stories.
Alice wants her books to fill a gap in the market. She thinks many books for children are either too sad or too fantastical. She wants her books to be in between. Alice used to teach English and History together. She loved seeing students go from being bored to being interested and understanding. She sees writing as an extension of teaching.
Alice started writing because she wanted to fill a gap in the market, but she was also inspired by the idea of not working with her children when they left home. Her head teacher suggested she take a creative writing course, and Alice was surprised. She had to send her best writing to the course organizers, and they accepted her immediately. The other students on the course liked her writing and encouraged her to publish it. Alice's husband, Zachary Leader, helped her edit her book. He read her chapters and suggested changes. Alice said, "My mother-in-law thinks we're now rivals, but I think we complement each other. He helps me make my writing better."

'Two brothers, Jonny and Alistair Brownlee, are professional triathletes. They are taking part in a special race to raise money for charity. Jonny will drive a car on the roads, while Alistair will ride a mountain bike across the countryside. They will start at a lake in the Yorkshire Dales and finish at the highest road in the area.
Jonny is looking forward to the race. He says the roads are beautiful, but also very cold. Alistair is excited too, but he is wearing warm clothes because he will be outside for a long time. He jokes that his brother might not even make it to the finish.
The race starts, and Alistair quickly gets ahead on his bike. Jonny has to drive carefully because there are obstacles on the road, like a tractor. Alistair has to get off his bike and carry it up a steep hill. Finally, they both reach the top of the hill, and Alistair starts to pedal fast.
Jonny has to drive slowly through the narrow roads and a stream. Alistair is almost at the finish, but he doesn't know if his brother is close. He crosses the finish line and looks up to see if Jonny is there. When he sees his brother's car, he is happy and raises his arms in the air. Jonny is disappointed that he didn't win, but he congratulates his brother on his victory.'

'When I play on Centre Court at Wimbledon, I notice the silence. The soft grass, the historic stadium, and the players in white clothes all make me feel like I'm in my own world. It's easy to focus on the game. The only noise I hear is the sound of my own shots and the applause when a point is over. I'm so focused that I don't even think about the 15,000 people watching me. I'm playing Roger Federer in the 2008 Wimbledon final, the biggest match of my life. I've always dreamed of playing at Wimbledon. My coach, my uncle Toni, has always told me that this is the most important tournament. I've played here before and lost, but I'm more determined now. I was really upset after my last loss in 2007. I felt like I had wasted my chance. Toni told me not to cry, that there would be more chances. He was right. I'm here again in 2008, and I'm more confident than ever. I know I've learned from my mistakes, and I'm ready to win.'

'Jane Goodall, a young English woman, went to Africa in 1957. She was very excited to be there and wrote to her family: "I am living in the Africa I have always dreamed of." She spent most of her life in Africa, working as a scientist, journalist, and environmentalist. Jane Goodall became famous for her research on chimpanzees. In 1963, a British organization published articles and TV programs about her work. She wrote books for children and adults, and one of her books, "In the Shadow of Man", was a bestseller. Jane Goodall is one of the most famous female scientists of the 20th century. However, many people only know her as a brave and adventurous person who loves animals. But she is much more than that. She is a pioneer in her field and a leading expert on chimpanzees. Jane Goodall's work has changed the way we understand animals and ourselves. She showed that chimpanzees are not just wild animals, but have feelings and social lives similar to ours. Before her research, people didn't know that chimpanzees ate meat, used tools, or had emotions. Jane Goodall's book, "The Chimpanzees of Gombe", is a leading reference book in the field. Her work has helped us understand chimpanzees and ourselves better. Even as a child, Jane Goodall showed an interest in animals. When she was five years old, she crawled into a henhouse to see how hens lay eggs. This might have been the start of her career as a biologist.'

Shirley Ford is a voiceover artist who can speak in many different voices. She can be a cheeky 8-year-old boy, a tired mother, an old Scottish woman, and even a fast-talking alien! She talks about what it takes to do voiceovers. 'Lots of actors think they can do funny voices, but it's not just about that,' she says. 'You have to bring the script to life for people who can't see you.' Shirley didn't always want to do voiceovers. She started out as an actress, but then she discovered she could do voices and that's what she wanted to do.
Shirley has worked on many different projects, including cartoons, educational videos, and even vacuum cleaner adverts. She has to use different voices for different characters. For example, she has to make her voice sound lighter when she's playing a child. She collects new voices by watching children's TV and cartoons. Shirley thinks that the key to being a good voiceover artist is to be able to smile while you're talking. This makes your voice sound happy and cheerful.
It's very competitive to get work as a voiceover artist, but Shirley has been successful because she is determined and has a lot of experience. She recommends attending special workshops to learn more about voiceovers and to practice your skills. Shirley loves her job and is obsessed with voices. She even finds that sometimes she starts talking in different voices at home, even when she's not recording.

People often ask me how I became a cartoonist. It's a dream job that many people have as children, like being a race car driver. But most people give up on these childish dreams and choose more realistic jobs, like being a lawyer or a car parts maker. It's hard to believe that you can make a living by drawing simple doodles, but some people do it. Not everyone becomes a cartoonist in the same way, but most who do have wanted to do it for a long time. I studied graphic design in college and then started drawing cartoons for different companies. I was lucky to find a newspaper that wanted to publish my work. You don't need a lot to become a cartoonist. You don't need a university degree, you don't need a lot of money, and you don't even need to be a good artist. You just need your brain, your hand, and something to draw with. But it's not easy to be a cartoonist. You need to be good at many things and be willing to work hard. I've done many different types of cartoons, including political cartoons, comic strips, and comic books. I've also written, drawn caricatures, and designed things. I don't turn down any work, because you can learn a lot from any job. It's also helpful to be smart, well-read, and curious about the world. The business side of being a cartoonist can be difficult. It used to be easy to find a job drawing cartoons for newspapers and magazines, but now it's harder. Most cartoonists have to sell their own work. The more comfortable you are with this, the better you'll do. I've seen many cartoonists with average artistic skills but good business skills do better than those with amazing artistic skills but no business skills. Some people are worried that someone will steal their ideas, but you can protect your work by putting a 'c' for 'copyright' on it. It's more likely that no one will be interested in your work, but if someone steals your cartoon and it becomes popular, it can be a good thing!

Twenty years ago, I was moving house and getting rid of old things. I decided to throw away an electric guitar that my dad had given me for my 16th birthday. I don't usually get rid of things easily, but I was going to throw this guitar away. I took it to the dump and was about to put it in the rubbish, when a young man stopped me. 'You're not going to throw that away, are you?' he asked. I said yes, but then felt sorry for what I was doing. He asked if he could have it, and I said okay. Later, I regretted giving it away. Then, a few months ago, I received an email from a guitar dealer named Keith. He said he had my guitar and wanted to sell it back to me. I was amazed! He had found a label on the back with my name on it and used it to find me online. I was so happy to get my guitar back. My dad used to put his name and address on everything I had, including my guitar. I forgot about that. My parents wanted me to learn classical guitar, but I didn't like it. I switched to electric guitar and played simple songs. Now, I'm going to learn again. It feels good to play it again. Maybe I can even play with my son, who is learning the saxophone. We could call our band 'The Regainers'!

Here is a simplified version of the text, suitable for a learner of English at level B1 on the CEFR:
There's been a lot of talk about sleep recently. When I wrote a book about people who can't sleep, I felt like I was the only one warning about the dangers of not sleeping enough. Sleep is very important for our minds, bodies, and moods. People who have trouble sleeping know how important it is. So, it's good that sleep is getting more attention. But I'm wondering, what about dreams? We're not talking about dreams much. When we wake up early, we often cut off the last hour or two of sleep, which is when we have the most vivid and memorable dreams. A good sleeper spends about a quarter of their sleep time dreaming. When researchers don't let people sleep, they have more and more dreams the next night. This shows that dreams are important.
Some researchers used to think that dreams were a way to understand how our minds work. But now they think that dreams are more about our physical bodies than our minds. There isn't much agreement on what dreams are for. A scientist at Harvard University says that people who are creative, like actors, writers, and directors, have a better memory for their dreams. This makes sense, because creative people often use their dreams to come up with new ideas. But I think that everyone needs to use their dreams, not just creative people. We all need to think creatively in our daily lives, whether we're teachers, software designers, or politicians. Dreams help us bring together different ideas and find new connections. This can help us solve problems and come up with new ideas. For example, a scientist found that when people wake up from a dream, they can come up with more original ideas than when they wake up from other stages of sleep. I also find that when I wake up from a dream, I can write more easily. Even if the dream is scary or hard to remember, it can help me think more clearly. This is why we all need to dream.

Twenty years ago, Susie Ray left London and moved to a small coastal town in England. She has a studio with a beautiful view of the sea. You can see empty frames on the walls and photos of her two daughters smiling. Susie is a very good artist who copies famous paintings. She can make them look exactly like the originals. People love her work and buy it from her. She has copied paintings by famous artists like Renoir, Monet, and Van Gogh.
Susie is very good at her job, but she doesn't have any of her own paintings at home. She finishes them and sells them to galleries and private collectors. Some people buy her paintings because they like art, but others do it because they want to show off. Susie says it's okay if people display her copies as if they were the originals, but she doesn't do it herself.
Susie used to work as an illustrator for a botanical garden, drawing plants. She was very good at it and learned to be very accurate. She didn't get paid much, but it helped her develop her skills. Now, she specializes in copying French impressionist paintings. She thinks people underestimate how hard it is to copy these paintings because they look easy, but they are actually very difficult.
Some people ask Susie why she doesn't create her own paintings. She says she has tried, but they don't turn out as well as her copies. She is a perfectionist and likes to do what she is good at. She makes a good living from copying paintings, and she is happy with her job.

Ellen MacArthur was a sailor who loved the sea. She was obsessed with being the fastest sailor on the water. When she was on her boat, she felt like she was one with the sea. After she finished her sailing career, she realized that she wanted to use her skills to help the planet. She started to think about how people use too many non-renewable resources. She believed that we need to find a way to use less and reuse things. Ellen travels around the world, talking to people about this problem. She also started a charity to help young people think about how to make the world a more sustainable place.

'Jordan Romero is 13 years old and wants to climb Mount Everest, the highest mountain in the world. If he succeeds, he will be the youngest person to do so. Jordan's team, which includes his parents, wants to inspire other young people to get outside and be active. They also want to climb the highest mountains on each continent, which is a very difficult challenge. Some experienced climbers think it's not a good idea for a 13-year-old to climb Everest because they might not be strong enough emotionally or have enough experience. Jordan's parents, who are also climbers, think they can help him and that he is getting stronger and more responsible every day. Jordan says he loves the challenge of climbing and wants to achieve his goal. His parents want him to stay motivated and focused on his goal. They also know that if Jordan gets bored with climbing, they will stop the project and do something else he enjoys, like playing basketball.'

Here is a simplified version of the text for a learner of level B1 on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR):
'When you see a teenager with an MP3 player, you can be sure they're not listening to classical music. Most people know the names of many pop groups, but ask your friends if they know who Brahms is and you'll see a surprised face. I'm studying music at university, but my classmates know just as little about classical music as anyone else our age. If you don't know who wrote the music, you're unlikely to buy their records. The statistics are worrying for classical music fans. Only 3% of concert tickets sold last year were for classical music events, and most classical albums sell fewer than 300 copies. So, why has classical music lost its appeal? The older generation blames our love of TV and video games, but I don't think that's the reason. The truth is that classical music doesn't interest most people, especially teenagers. I know some teenagers who love classical music, but they're a minority. I'm a musician and play in an orchestra, but I'm not a big fan of classical music myself. I like many types of music, but my computer shows that I listen to classical music very little. So, why don't teenagers like classical music? One reason is that classical music is slow and has many changes in mood, which is hard for us to follow. We like fast-paced music and prefer to listen to it while doing something else. Pop music is simple and easy to listen to, while classical music requires concentration. Pop music also deals with issues that are more relevant to teenagers. The way we listen to music has changed too. In the past, families would make music together at home, and being able to play an instrument was important. Nowadays, you can find any music you want on the internet, and classical music is rarely part of our daily lives.'

Here is the simplified text for a learner of English at the B1 level:
Bonnie Wyndham got out of her mother's car and looked at Almonside School. 'I'll show you,' she said to the school. Her mother was getting out of the car at the same time, but Bonnie wouldn't have minded if she had heard. Bonnie's mother knew how she felt.
Mrs. Wyndham looked around. Almonside School was a strange place, with buildings hidden among the trees on a hillside. It was confusing at first, but then she saw signs on a post: 'Science block', 'gymnasium', 'riding centre'. 'Riding centre,' Bonnie said, showing interest. 'The headmaster's study,' her mother said. 'This way.'
Bonnie followed her mother along a wide path between trees. 'I wish you would walk beside me instead of following me like a dog,' her mother said, but Bonnie didn't do as she was told. A few minutes later, her mother was talking to the headmaster in his office, while Bonnie sat outside the door. Bonnie got up. 'Why should I just sit here?' she thought. 'I'll be sent away soon anyway, so why not get it over with?' She left the building and went to the riding centre. There was a nice old building where the horses were kept, and a big structure for indoor riding. Bonnie looked around, but there was no one there. She approached the horses with respect. She liked horses.
Almost every stall was occupied, and she walked along, looking at each horse and judging it. 'I know what they're doing here,' she said to a small pony. 'You know, I think I've met you before,' she said to another horse. 'In my dreams, and I was riding you in a big competition...' The horse's name was Maverick. Bonnie couldn't resist the temptation to ride him. She found a saddle and bridle, and put them on Maverick. When she sat on his back, she felt like a queen. She laughed, remembering her nickname 'Queen Bee'. 'You're the best horse I've ever ridden, Maverick,' she said. 'I think we could be great friends if I stay here.'
She rode Maverick around the paddock, feeling happy and free. She could tell Maverick trusted her, and she felt sure he would jump well.

Here is the simplified version of the text for a learner of English at the B1 level:
Cody Simpson is a 15-year-old Australian singer who has already had a lot of success. I met him once and was impressed by his calm and confident personality. So, how did a surfer boy end up performing in front of thousands of people?
Cody started playing the guitar when he was six and writing songs when he was seven. But at that time, he was more interested in swimming and surfing. He went to school and posted some videos online. People loved them and asked for more. Cody was happy to share more videos, and the response was amazing.
Cody was a good swimmer and was training hard. But then record labels contacted him, and he had to make a difficult decision: stay in Australia and keep swimming or move to the US and pursue music. He chose to take the risk and move to the US with his family.
It was hard for him to make this decision at such a young age. He had to tell his swimming coach and friends that he was leaving. They were all surprised. Cody is a modest person and thinks it's important to stay humble in the music industry.
Cody's family is not in the spotlight, but they support him. He thinks it's important to have a small group of close people around you to keep you grounded. Of course, he has doubts sometimes. He worries about how his decision affects his younger brother and sister. But his family reassures him that they are there to support him.
Cody's story shows that success comes from taking risks and saying "yes" to opportunities, even when they are scary. He never thought he would be performing in front of so many people, but it's happening. He knows it won't last forever.

I woke up early and looked out of my bedroom window. The river was frozen, but there was a small crack in the ice. I could see the wall of sandbags along the riverbank, which were there to protect the buildings from flooding. My back was still sore from lifting the sandbags the previous week. I had worked with the rest of the town's adults for many hours to get the job done. My grandfather didn't seem to care, though.
As I got dressed, I saw a boy on the other side of the river. He was trying to balance on a thin piece of ice near the warm water coming from the factory. I put on my special wetsuit and grabbed my kayaking jacket. I checked my pocket for a special chain my grandfather gave me, which is very important to me. I also have a diary he kept on one of his adventures, which I like to read before I go to sleep.
I went downstairs to the kitchen, where my mom was making breakfast. 'Good morning, Rex,' she said. 'You're up early today. Be careful kayaking.' I said goodbye to my mom and headed out the door.
As I was leaving, I ran into my grandfather. 'Watch where you're going!' he shouted. 'Where are you going?' I told him I was going kayaking. He's always grumpy, but I try not to mind. He's been acting strange lately, and I feel sorry for him.
I put on my kayaking gear and headed to the river. As I was getting ready, I saw the boy from earlier trying to balance on the ice again. I decided to go and help him.

Mum took Jess's arm and led her to the study. There, on the table, was a painting by Grandpa. It was unfinished and looked very different from his other work. 'Do you know anything about this?' Mum asked. Jess shook her head. 'I've never seen it before. I didn't know he was working on something new.' The painting showed a river, but it was not a real river. It was a fantasy river. The picture was strange and beautiful in a weird way. There were no animals, no birds, no people. Jess was drawn to the painting. Mum said, 'It has a name.' Jess read the words on the back: 'River Boy.' She felt a strange connection to the name, but she didn't know why. Mum told her that Grandpa never gave his paintings names, but this one had a name. Jess looked at Mum and asked, 'There is no boy in the painting.' Mum said, 'Exactly. It's strange that he would give it a name like that.' Jess knew that Grandpa never explained his paintings. He believed that each painting had its own meaning and that people either understood it or they didn't. Mum had asked him about the painting, and he had said that artists should focus on their work, not explain it to everyone who asks.

I didn't mean to cut a hole in my bedroom carpet. I wasn't thinking about cutting holes, but I wanted to put a special cabinet in my room. My grandmother gave me the cabinet, and it's very nice. It's small and has a special shape that fits in a corner. My room is a bit small and shaped like a wedge of cheese. I have a bed in one corner and a wardrobe in the other. I wanted to put the cabinet in the remaining space, but it was a bit too tall. I thought about cutting a small piece off the bottom, but then I had an idea. I could cut a hole in the carpet! I thought my dad would be proud of me for thinking outside the box. He always tells us to be creative and think differently. So, I cut a hole in the carpet and put the cabinet in. It looks great in my room now.

'The Borrowers' is a story about a family of small people who live in the walls and floors of a house. They take things from the normal-sized people who live in the house to survive. When I was asked to make a TV version of the book, I knew it would be difficult. People who love the book have strong ideas about how it should be done. I used the original drawings from the book to make sure I got it right. The author wanted the series to be from the Borrowers' point of view, not from the point of view of the normal-sized people. This made filming more complicated. The most important thing was getting the size right. The Borrowers are much smaller than humans, so we had to film them from a distance that was 10 times further away than normal. When filming the normal-sized surroundings, the crew had to crawl on the ground and film from very low down. We only raised the cameras above their height for special shots. One challenge was making the shadows look right when we combined the images of the small Borrowers with the normal-sized surroundings. We developed a special technique for this. After the series was shown, a famous film director, George Lucas, called me to ask how I did it. The only permanent set we built was the Borrowers' home under the floorboards of the house. It was very surreal. The actors had to carry big objects, like giant scissors, and it was funny. We had to stop filming sometimes because the crew was laughing too much. There was one scene where the Borrowers get swept away by a drain. The actors had to go through a tunnel with water and they said it was very scary. I was careful about the costumes, making them look like doll clothes. The actors had a hard time wearing them and couldn't sit down or take them off. The weather was very hot during filming, and the actors didn't thank me for the costumes! We had to film most scenes with the actors separate from their surroundings, in front of a blue screen. It was hard for them to react to things that weren't there. I drew pictures of every scene to show people how it should look. It took me a long time, but it worked. We had to work fast and efficiently - I even shot a whole scene before realising there was no film in the camera! But in the end, I think the series was successful in capturing the magic of the book.'

My mom drops me off at my new school, Palm Grove High School. She looks around nervously, making sure no journalists are there. I tell her everything will be okay. She gives me a kiss and leaves. I'm excited to start at this new school. I wanted to leave my old life on the road and tour with my dad's band. Now we're staying in one place for good. I want to make new friends who have normal jobs, like a mom who works in an office or a dad who cuts grass. I go to the school office to get my schedule. The secretary is not very friendly, but I show her my schedule and she gives it to me. My first class is English Literature. I'm a bit late, but I know where the classroom is because I studied the map last night. When I get there, the teacher is already taking roll. I slip in quietly and sit down next to a girl who smiles at me. She likes my shoes, but I think I made a mistake wearing them. The teacher introduces herself and gives us our course outlines. We have to read some books this year. Then she lets us talk to each other. My new friend asks me why I moved here. I could tell her the truth, but I decide to say my dad had to move for work. She asks what he does, and I say he's an artist. She seems okay with that. Her name is Becca, and I'm glad to have someone to talk to.

'American teenagers have a lot of responsibilities. They are expected to be good students, have a part-time job, volunteer, and do well in all these areas. This is what it means to be an American teenager today. Teenagers can't just blend into the background; they need to stand out. Many people think that teenagers are lazy, but this is not always true.
Teenagers have a lot of stress. They have a lot of homework, tests, and activities, and they also have to take care of their daily responsibilities at home. On top of this, they try to have some kind of social life. This can be very tiring.
Some people think that teenagers spend all their time watching TV and playing with their phones. But this is not true. Teenagers use their phones to help them with their work and to stay in touch with their friends. They can do their homework anywhere, at any time.
Teenagers start their day early and often finish late at night. They have to get up early and do their homework, and then they have to do it all again the next day. Many teenagers don't get enough sleep. The US National Sleep Foundation says that only about 20% of teenagers get the recommended nine hours of sleep a night.
Despite all their responsibilities, many teenagers still find time to help others. They volunteer and do things that help their community. They don't just focus on themselves; they care about others too.
In the future, who knows what people will think about teenagers? But one thing is for sure - they will still be surprising people and making a difference in the world.'

'The Earth to Sky Calculus Club is a group of teenagers who live near Bishop, a town in the US surrounded by mountains. They have been launching balloons into space for several years. The balloons go up to 35 km high, and the students use them to study the stars and the Earth's atmosphere. They also have an adventure while doing it. I joined them one weekend to see how they do it.
On this day, they were going to launch a balloon to see shooting stars. Shooting stars happen when a rock or metal from space enters the Earth's atmosphere and makes a bright light. They attached a special box to the balloon with a camera, a device to measure altitude, and a thermometer to measure the temperature. They also attached two GPS trackers to find the box later.
The balloon grew bigger and bigger, like a small car, and then it took off. The students ran to track its path with flashlights, and they were amazed by the sight. Then the balloon disappeared into the night.
After the launch, some students went home, but a few stayed to watch the stars. They lay on blankets on the mountainside and looked at the sky. It was very clear and beautiful, and they could see many stars. One boy fell asleep, and the others whispered to each other.
The balloon eventually popped and the box fell back to Earth. The students used the GPS trackers to find it the next day. It was a big adventure, and they enjoyed it. They have only lost two boxes out of 53 launches. They like the challenge of finding the boxes, and it helps them learn about the landscape and how to navigate it.
This time, the box landed 84 km west of Bishop, and it took them 11 hours to find it. It was in a canyon, near a waterfall. They didn't get any pictures of shooting stars, but they had a great time and learned a lot.'

Chloe Morgan didn't always like science, especially not palaeontology. But when she was 15, she saw an article about dinosaurs and it changed everything. She started to get really interested in the subject.
Chloe remembers meeting a professional palaeontologist, Matt Cornelius, for the first time. She was a bit nervous, but he was very kind and patient. He listened to her questions and made her feel at ease.
I ask Chloe about how palaeontologists are often shown in movies and TV shows. She says that they are often portrayed as eccentric geniuses or nerdy people who don't know how to relate to others. She thinks this is not very accurate.
Chloe's job is very varied. She spends time digging up dinosaur bones, studying fossils in the laboratory, and writing scientific papers. She also likes to explain science to the public and help young people understand it.
Chloe was involved in a TV documentary about dinosaurs called Walking with Dinosaurs. She was happy to help make sure the dinosaurs were accurate and realistic. She thinks dinosaurs continue to fascinate us because they remind us of the unknown and the excitement of discovery. Palaeontology is a way to travel back in time and learn about the past.

When you're on a car trip with your family, you probably know you're not there yet, even if you keep asking 'Are we there yet?' And the truth is, once you arrive, it's not 'there' anymore, it's 'here'. So, if you really think you're 'there' yet, you should ask 'Are we here yet?' 
As a child, you might think it's boring to be in the back seat. You can watch movies, listen to music, or do puzzles while looking out the window at the passing scenery. The grown-ups are in charge and take care of everything, making sure everyone is happy. But sometimes, one of your siblings might do something annoying, like put their foot on your side of the seat. This can lead to a fight, and the grown-ups will tell them to stay in their own seat and keep their hands to themselves.
Sometimes, the car ride can get a bit crazy. You might feel a breeze on your arm, but the window is closed and the car isn't going that fast. It's just your sibling blowing air on you on purpose. This can make you angry, and the fight might start again.
Grown-ups have ways to deal with kids on long car trips. For example, they might say, 'We're there!' even when you're still on the highway. This can keep everyone quiet for a while. And you know you're finally 'there' when the grown-ups get out of the car and go away from the kids.
So, remember: if the grown-ups are still near enough to answer your question, the answer is 'no, you're not there yet'.

John and Zuzi Morgan have started a café in Oxford where people can play board games while having a cup of coffee and some cake. They want people to enjoy themselves so much that they will come back. Zuzi explains why they decided to open a café: 'People are always busy with their phones and other devices. We wanted to bring people together in a way that's not just about screens. It's natural for people to be together and communicate with each other.'
The games they play at the café are called 'Eurogames'. They are known for being fun and not too competitive. The first Eurogame was 'The Settlers of Catan', created by a German designer. Players build settlements and trade resources with each other. It's a fun game that keeps everyone involved until the end.
Another popular Eurogame is 'Pandemic', where players work together to solve problems. It was created by an American designer who was inspired by a game called 'Lord of the Rings'. He wanted to make a game that would make people feel good, whether they won or lost.
The growth of video games has actually helped board games become more popular. More people are playing games now than ever before. Some people started looking for a way to play games with friends and family in person, so they started playing board games again.
John and Zuzi's café is very popular, and people enjoy playing games together. In our online world, playing games has become something to be shared with others in person. This trend is likely to continue.
