Tony Connor is a famous street trials cyclist. He does amazing stunts on his bike, like jumping from one high place to another. These stunts are recorded and put on the internet. I met Tony at a BMX park on a Saturday morning. The local kids knew who he was and came to say hello. Even some older people came to admire him, calling him a 'legend'. I was impressed by his bravery, creativity, and willingness to take risks. Before each stunt, Tony explains what he's going to do, and I often think it's impossible. But he always manages to do it. After the stunt, I complimented him, but he seemed not to care. Despite being famous, Tony doesn't like the social side of being a celebrity. He prefers to focus on his bike riding rather than talking about it.
Tony's fame is thanks to social media and the small cameras that can record his stunts. He thinks this technology has given him the opportunity to make a living doing what he loves. However, he sometimes feels that people are too focused on taking selfies or watching screens. Tony's attitude is ironic because his fame is partly due to social media.
I've noticed that there are two important things that make someone a top athlete: energy and the ability to deal with disappointment. These qualities are more important than natural talent. The riskier the sport, the more important it is to have mental strength. Tony fell a few times when trying new obstacles, but he just got up and kept trying until he mastered them. Some people think Tony is reckless, but he says they don't understand the sport and the risks are minimized with expert advice.
Tony is aware of the risks he takes and knows that everyone is different. Some people are naturally brave, while others can be scared. Tony is in the group that feels fear but finds a way to overcome it. He's not addicted to risk and spends time planning and preparing before attempting a new stunt. He knows he has to stay focused before he jumps.

Research is an important part of learning and working. It's not just for experts or famous scientists, but for everyone. Research helps us build knowledge and skills. It's a way of thinking about the world and doing our own work.
As a student, you contribute to knowledge by asking questions and finding answers. You don't just memorize information, you make it. To research, you ask questions like "Why?", "How?", "What if?", and "What does it mean?"
Research can be big and complex, or small and everyday. Some people think it's only for experts, but it's actually a natural part of learning and working. You've probably been doing research without realizing it, like when you ask questions about something you don't understand or try to find the best way to do something.
At college and university, you're expected to be curious and ask questions. You should think critically about what you read and hear, and not just accept what others say. You need to be able to evaluate information and think about whether it's true or not.
It's important to be critical and not just believe everything you read or are told. You need to think about whether the information is logical and backed by evidence. This is important not just for research, but for your whole life and career.

Cities have always been important for learning and creativity. In the past, people would gather in coffee shops in cities like London and Paris to discuss new ideas. However, city life can be challenging. The same coffee shops that inspired creativity also spread diseases like cholera. Pablo Picasso, the famous artist, even left the city to live in the countryside.
Scientists are now studying how cities affect our brains. They have found that city life can make us less clever and more tired. One reason for this is that cities lack something that is good for our brains: nature. Studies have shown that when people can see trees or plants, they recover faster from illnesses. Even just looking at nature for a short time can help our brains work better.
Most people now live in cities, which is a big change from the past. Instead of living in the countryside, we are surrounded by many people and buildings. This can affect our mental and physical health, and how we think. When we walk in a city, we have to pay attention to many things, like other people and cars. This can be tiring for our brains.
Scientists have found that cities are too busy and overwhelming for our brains. We need to constantly focus on what is important and ignore what is not. This takes a lot of energy and effort. Natural places, on the other hand, don't require as much mental effort. This is called attention restoration theory.
Some people think that being in nature can help our brains rest and work better. This idea was first suggested by a psychologist named Stephen Kaplan. He believed that being in nature can help our brains recover from the stress of city life.
Philosophers and architects have been warning about the effects of city life for a long time. They have been looking for ways to include more nature in cities. Parks and green spaces can help people escape the stress of city life and improve their brain function.
Some people have been searching for ways to improve their brains, such as taking energy drinks or changing their work environment. However, taking a walk in nature may be the most effective way to improve cognitive performance.
Despite the challenges of city life, cities continue to be important for creativity and innovation. The crowded streets and many people in cities can actually help stimulate creativity and innovation. This is because the concentration of people and ideas can lead to new discoveries and inventions.
The key is to find a balance between the benefits and challenges of city life. We need to find ways to mitigate the negative effects of city life while still enjoying its benefits.

'Where do we find the mind? This might seem like a strange question. We often think that thinking happens inside our heads. But I think we should look beyond the skin and the skull. There is a lot of evidence that shows that things, not just our brains, are involved in our thinking. From ancient times to the present day, we have found many examples of how objects, like stones, have helped humans think and learn. 
It's easy to understand why we often think of the mind and the brain as the same thing. Most of what we know about the mind comes from studying people who are alone, without their usual surroundings. But this means we often forget that our thinking can happen outside our heads. I'm not saying that the brain isn't important, but I think we should consider the idea that our minds are more than just our brains. 
Instead, I suggest we explore the idea that our intelligence is connected to the world around us. This is where my new theory, Material Engagement Theory (MET), comes in. MET looks at how objects become part of our thinking and how they help us learn. It also examines how this has changed over time and what it means for how we think. 
For example, think of a blind person using a stick. Where does their self begin? The stick becomes part of their body, and they use it to'see' the world. This shows us that our minds are always changing and adapting to new things. 
I believe that our minds are unfinished and always evolving. We use objects to help us understand the world and to make sense of things. This is why humans make things, and those things in turn shape our minds. I call this metaplasticity – our minds are flexible and change as we interact with the world. 
I want to show how important it is to consider the role of objects in our thinking. MET offers a new way of understanding how different objects, from ancient stones to modern smartphones, have helped shape our minds and how we think.'

'Photography has changed the way we see the world. In the United States, it became an important part of American culture, not just in science and art, but also in everyday life. Historians say that photography is the country's most significant contribution to the visual arts. This is because photography has become a central part of American intellectual and artistic discussions. To understand its impact, we need to look at its beginnings in the 19th century.
So, why was photography so popular? Firstly, it was a mechanical process that matched the American enthusiasm for technology. Just as new technologies like steam power and electricity made the world smaller, photography brought the world into people's homes. Secondly, the camera was a way to show people how they looked, and Americans were interested in presenting themselves to the public. Thirdly, the camera was important for creating and sharing memories of families and personal experiences.
Photographs are unique because they are records of real events, people, and things. They can be objective, but they also have a personal perspective. When we look at a photograph, we might think we know what it means, but its meaning can be influenced by the context in which we see it. To understand a photograph, we need to consider its purpose, the culture it was made in, and how people saw it. The same image can have different meanings in different places and times.
Photography has become an important part of art, and many artists now use photographs in their work. In fact, photography has become an essential part of how we represent the world.'

William James, an American philosopher and doctor, defined psychology as the'science of mental life' in 1890. This definition is still relevant today. We all have thoughts and feelings, and we know what it means to have a mental life. However, psychology is a complex subject that can be difficult to understand. James believed that psychology involves three main elements: thoughts and feelings, the physical world, and our way of understanding these things. Each of us has our own thoughts, feelings, and experiences, and these can influence our understanding of the world. This means that we can make judgments about psychological issues based on our own experiences, but this can also lead to misunderstandings.
Psychologists try to find answers to psychological questions by studying people's behavior and using scientific methods. They want to understand what is happening inside our minds and how it affects our behavior. However, it is difficult to study the mind directly, so psychologists use indirect methods, such as observing people's behavior and making educated guesses about what is happening inside their minds.
Psychology is a challenging subject because it is hard to prove or disprove scientific facts about the mind. Psychologists have to be careful when making observations and drawing conclusions. They use scientific methods to study the mind and develop theories about how it works. The goal of psychology is to understand the mind and use this knowledge to help people in their daily lives.
Psychological research has many practical applications, such as helping children learn to read, designing safer machines, and treating people who are emotionally distressed. Despite the challenges, psychologists continue to study the mind and develop new theories and methods to help us better understand ourselves and others.

"In a special warehouse in Michigan, USA, there is a collection of products that did not sell well. This collection is called the Museum of Failed Products. The owner of the museum, Carol Sherry, thinks that each product has a sad story behind it. The museum is interesting because it is a successful business. Many companies do not keep track of their failed products, but Carol Sherry's collection is a reminder that many products do not succeed.
The museum's owner, Robert McMath, started collecting products in the 1960s. He wanted to have a library of consumer products, not just failed ones. However, most of the products he collected were unsuccessful. This is because many products do not sell well.
The culture of optimism might be responsible for this. Companies often invest more money in a product even if it is not doing well. This is because they do not want to admit that the product is a failure. They also do not want to talk about what went wrong.
The concept of 'positive visualisation' is popular in the self-help industry. This means that if you imagine something going well, it is more likely to happen. However, research suggests that this is not always true. In fact, thinking about how well something could go can actually make people less motivated to achieve their goals.
Psychologist Carol Dweck suggests that people's experiences of failure are influenced by their beliefs about ability. Some people believe that ability is fixed, while others believe it can be developed through hard work and challenge. People who believe that ability is fixed are often very upset when they fail, while those who believe it can be developed see failure as an opportunity to learn and grow."

"Sports teams usually do better when they play at home. But why is this? Many people think it's obvious, but things are changing in sports and we need to think again. Scientists and people who make money from sports are looking at this question. They want to know what makes players perform well and how to explain the advantage of playing at home. Some people think that if players are paid well, they should feel comfortable anywhere. But what about the fans? Would it matter if a team like Manchester United played some of their home games in a different country? It would matter to the fans who love their team and want them to do well.
We often think that something happens because of what we see, not because of what really happened. When a team scores a goal, the fans cheer loudly. But what about all the times when the team didn't score? We remember the cheering, not the times when it didn't happen. Home fans often shout at the referee, trying to help their team. In a study, referees watched a game with and without crowd noise. The ones who heard the noise were less likely to call fouls against the home team. This is because referees don't want to make decisions that will make the crowd angry.
Studying home advantage over time shows that it's not as big as it used to be. In the past, home teams won 70% of the time, but now it's 60%. This might be because travel used to be harder, but now players are treated well and have good hotels. The stadiums are also similar now. But none of these reasons really explains why home advantage is different in different sports. Basketball is the sport where home advantage is biggest, followed by football. Baseball is the sport where home advantage is smallest. This might be because baseball is more about individual players, not teams working together. Team sports are about working together, and playing at home makes teams feel more confident. There's also a possibility that playing at home is connected to a natural desire to defend our territory, like in the old days of rugby.
Players' testosterone levels are higher before home matches, which might be connected to this territorial feeling. This is a natural instinct to defend our home turf. As one referee said, 'It's the law of the jungle out there.'"

'Gary Player, a famous golfer, once said, "The more I practice, the luckier I get." This phrase is well-known among athletes and coaches. It's easy to understand why. The quote is often debated, and its meaning is not clear. Player didn't mean he was lucky; he was being ironic. He meant that the more he practices, the better he gets. But where does this idea stop? Is there a limit to how much practice is needed? This is the heart of the debate about whether talent is born or acquired.
Psychologist Anders Ericsson thinks that with 10,000 hours of practice, anyone can become an expert in a field. Many books agree with him, saying that practice is more important than natural talent. However, a new book challenges this idea. The author, Epstein, argues that it's not that simple. He thinks that the way we look at successful people is wrong. We often focus on the successful ones and try to figure out why they're successful, but we don't consider other factors.
Epstein travels around the world to find answers. He visits Kenya, Sweden, and Alaska, and even looks at animals like sled dogs. He finds that some animals have a natural drive to work hard, which might be related to their genes. This makes him wonder if people's drive is also partly genetic.
Epstein says that both nature (our genes) and nurture (our environment) are important. He doesn't dismiss the importance of practice or environment, but he also thinks that some people might have a natural advantage. He looks at cases where genes play a big role and also discusses the difference between men and women in sports. He asks, "If practice is the only thing that matters, why do we separate men and women in competitions?" Sometimes the best questions are the most obvious ones.'

'I'm a psychologist who has studied a lot. I'm good at solving problems, but this skill doesn't come from school. Most problems in life can't be solved with just a formula or memorized answers. They require common sense, wisdom, and creativity, which come from life experiences. Children learn these skills through play. In fact, all mammals, including humans, play when they're young. The more they have to learn, the more they play. Children have a lot to learn, so they play a lot. Play is a natural way for adults and animals to learn. The most important skills children need to learn are those that can't be taught in school. These skills are learned through play, such as thinking creatively, getting along with others, and controlling their emotions. Creativity is important for success. We need people who can think creatively and solve new problems. This requires the ability to think creatively. The creative mind is a playful mind. Adults who are good at thinking creatively are those who retain their childlike curiosity throughout their lives. We can't teach creativity, but we can discourage it by focusing too much on what children should learn, rather than what they're interested in. It's more important for children to learn how to get along with others and work together. Children are naturally social and learn these skills through play. Play is voluntary, so children are free to stop if they want to. This freedom makes play a democratic activity. Unfortunately, school has become more stressful, and children don't have as much time for play as they used to. We need to give children more freedom to play and explore, so they can grow into strong, capable adults.'

'Many young people in their twenties are using social media to look for a job. Websites like Twitter and LinkedIn allow them to connect directly with potential employers. However, with this increased access comes a higher chance of making mistakes. A recent example is a young jobseeker who contacted a senior marketing executive on LinkedIn. The executive was not impressed and sent a harsh rejection message that went viral. This incident highlights the importance of using social media correctly when looking for a job. Many young people are not aware of the differences between using social media for personal and professional purposes.
When we were teenagers, social media was a way to escape from our parents and teachers. We used it to impress our friends and create a fantasy world. But when it comes to using social media for job hunting, it's a different story. We need to be professional and respectful. We need to remember that just because someone likes our posts on Facebook, it doesn't mean they will like our LinkedIn profile.
Employers often complain that young jobseekers on professional networking sites are too familiar and come across as arrogant. This can damage our chances of getting a job. To avoid this, we should introduce ourselves clearly, explain what we can offer, and be humble. We should not send impersonal emails and should be careful not to make a bad impression. Social media can be a great way to make useful contacts, but we need to use it wisely.'

Newspapers are in trouble. Their circulation has been falling since 2000. In the US, only 26% of people get their news from newspapers, compared to 45% in 2001. Many experts predict that newspapers will disappear within 15 years. However, old media have a way of surviving. For example, books, theatre, and cinema all survived the rise of new media. Radio and vinyl records have also made a comeback.
Newspapers were once new media too. They became popular in the 19th century with the invention of the steam press, the railway, and the telegraph. People needed up-to-date news, and newspapers provided it. However, the idea of needing regular news updates is a relatively new concept. In the past, people only needed to know about major events like famines, floods, or diseases.
Journalism as a profession is also a recent development. Before the 19th century, news was mostly spread through word of mouth or written letters. There was no need for regular news updates, and people didn't expect it.
Now, with the internet, people can get news whenever they want. They can search for specific topics and get instant updates. This is different from traditional newspapers, which had to publish news at a set time and had limited space. Online news can also be corrected quickly if there are errors or misconceptions.
Despite these changes, many news providers are still focused on being the first to break the news, rather than providing in-depth analysis and understanding. Perhaps they will learn to use the internet to guide people to wisdom and understanding.

'If we were meant to live in the dark, we would be happy to do so. But we are creatures that thrive in the light of day. Our bodies are adapted to living in the sun's light, even though we don't think about it much. We have managed to control the night by adding artificial light. This has some good effects, but also some bad ones. The bad effects are called light pollution. Light pollution is when we use too much light and it shines upwards into the sky, instead of just where we need it. This can affect many living things, including us. For most of human history, we didn't have much artificial light, so we didn't have light pollution. Imagine walking in London at night in the 1800s - it was very dark. We have lit up the night like it's an empty space, but it's not empty. Many animals are active at night, and light affects them a lot. Some birds get attracted to artificial light and fly into buildings or get caught in searchlights. Some birds even sing at the wrong times because of artificial light. We used to think light pollution only affected astronomers, but it affects us all. Darkness is important for our health and well-being. If we don't get enough darkness, our bodies don't work properly. We need darkness to sleep and wake up at the right times. So, light pollution is like a problem that affects our whole lives. We have cut ourselves off from our natural world and forgotten our place in the universe.'

'The boss of a big company has announced that they will no longer keep track of how many holidays their employees take. This decision was inspired by a company that already has a similar policy. The boss says that his idea came from an email from his daughter, but some people think it was actually written by someone from his team. The company with 2,000 employees and the big company with 50,000 employees are very different. The smaller company has a single service, while the big company has many different services like banking, transportation, and healthcare. The idea of taking as much time off as you want if it won't harm the business might work for a small company, but it's not suitable for a big company like this one.
The boss says that employees can take as much leave as they want as long as they're sure it won't harm the business or their careers. But it's hard to be 100% sure about this. Even if you prepare well for a holiday, there's always a lot of work to come back to. This is the nature of taking time off. People might not take holidays at all or feel guilty about taking them. This could lead to stress and a decrease in productivity.
In a big company, there's already pressure to work late and start early. This could become even worse if people feel they can't take holidays. They might feel they're not entitled to take time off and might not take it. The policy could also lead to people feeling like they're not allowed to take holidays, even though they're entitled to them. This could make people feel stuck and unable to take the time off they need.
Modern technology has made it easy to work from anywhere, which has blurred the line between work and free time. The company that started this policy did it because they wanted to make it fair. They said that if they can't track how many hours people work, they shouldn't track how many hours they're away from work. However, this means that all hours could be working hours, and employees might feel like they're always being watched. This could be bad for their mental and physical health.
Employment laws exist for a reason. People need time off to rest and relax, which is important for their well-being. I'm not sure if this policy will really help people take more holidays or if it's just a way to make them work more.'

'Scientific research papers are reviewed by experts in the same field to make sure they are accurate and trustworthy. This process is important, but it can take a long time. Some people think that publishing papers online without reviewing them first could be a good idea. This is called a preprint. It allows scientists to share their research quickly and get feedback from others. This is important because it helps to speed up the process of discovering new things.
However, some scientists are worried that publishing papers without reviewing them first could lead to bad research being published. But so far, this hasn't happened. In fact, preprints can be very helpful because they allow scientists to share their work and get feedback from others. This can help to improve the quality of the research.
Some scientists are also worried about the pressure to publish their research in top journals. This can lead to scientists cutting corners and not sharing all of their results. Preprints can help to reduce this pressure and focus on the research itself rather than where it is published.
Overall, preprints can be a useful way for scientists to share their research and get feedback from others. It can help to speed up the process of discovering new things and improve the quality of the research.'

When I ask my students what a poem is, they usually say it's like a painting with words. But I'm not satisfied with that answer. So, I asked them to write a paragraph describing an object, like a scientist would, and another paragraph from the object's point of view, called a 'Poem'. One student wrote about an oxygen mask. It's a strange choice, but it helped us understand how poetry is special.
When I was at school, I didn't like poetry. I thought it was confusing and didn't make sense. After school, most people don't think about poetry much. Sometimes you see a poem and it's different from normal writing. It's like a challenge, and you read it to see what it's about. But often, you might not understand it or find it boring. People usually look for poems to make them feel something, to see beautiful images, or to think deeply. But we can find those things in other things, like films or music.
So, what is a poem? Some people say it's like a puzzle, but it's not just that. A poem can be like a special kind of tool that helps us understand the world better. We can find poems in books, magazines, or online. They're different from other writing because they're not just for entertainment or information. Poems can surprise us, even if it's just for a moment.

I bought my first metal detector after I got married. It was £70, which was a lot of money then. My wife, Marion, was impressed when I found a gold ring worth £80 on my first trip out. Over the years, every coin and brooch I've found has given me pleasure. But it wasn't until 40 years later that I found something that impressed Marion as much as the gold ring.
One rainy afternoon, I went to a spot I knew had old farming equipment. My detector beeped, and I found a piece of a metal wheel. Then it beeped again. I dug down half a meter and found a golden ball. I thought it might be a piece of brass, but as I cleaned it, it became clear it was a beautiful, intricately patterned loop. I'd seen something like this before - the Great Torc, on display at the British Museum. It's a famous necklace from over 2,000 years ago.
I took the torc home and showed it to Marion. We didn't try it on because we didn't want to damage it. I hid it in our wardrobe, but I was worried about it getting stolen. Eventually, I hid it in my office under a floorboard. The law says that finds like this must be reported to the authorities within 14 days. I wanted to enjoy it first, so I took it to show a friend in hospital. Then I took it to the council office. The torc was authenticated and sold to my local council. The money was split between the owner of the field and me. The torc is now in the British Museum in London. The £350,000 we got was a surprise, but the torc has been more than just a lucky find. It's something I've saved for everyone.
People ask me if I'll stop detecting now, but I won't. I'll keep searching for more treasures. If a fisherman catches a big fish, he doesn't stop fishing - he keeps trying to catch an even bigger one.

'Sleep is one of my favourite things to do when I travel. But I don't often talk about it because I feel a bit guilty. When I'm in a new place, I feel like I'm taking in so many new sights, sounds, and smells. It's when I sleep that I can make sense of it all. Travel sleep is also different from sleep at home. It's like my body adjusts to the new place and its rhythms. For example, when I was in Trinidad, people woke up early in the morning, took a nap in the middle of the day, and then went out in the evening. It took me a few days to get used to this new routine. When I finally adjusted, I felt like I was really part of the place. Travel sleep is special because it's something I remember. When I'm in a new place, I notice all the little things that I wouldn't normally notice, like the smells and sounds of my surroundings. If you're a slow traveler, like me, you might think that sleep is an important part of the experience. Maybe I should stop feeling guilty about my love of sleep and tell my friends that it's an important part of traveling too.'

'The Red Bull Air Race is a thrilling competition where 12 pilots fly their planes through a course of 15-25 metre high pylons. They do sharp turns, barrel rolls, and loops at speeds of up to 370 km per hour. I was invited to try it out. Before the flight, I had to sign two forms. One was to confirm my good health, and the other was to empty my pockets because small objects can be dangerous during the flight. When we were about to take off, I was given a safety briefing. I was told not to touch anything in the plane. As we taxied down the runway, I felt a bit nervous. I was asked to promise that I would stay calm and focused during the flight. This is the challenge of high-speed flying - you have to stay calm to survive.
When we took off, we banked sharply to the right. It was a sudden and violent movement, and I felt the air squeeze out of my lungs. I looked up at the horizon and felt my stomach drop. We did some more sharp turns and dives, and I felt my stomach lurch. Then, I got to fly the plane for a few minutes. It was very responsive, but my hands were shaking a lot.

'Doug Allan films animals in cold places. He is a famous wildlife cameraman. He likes very cold temperatures, -18°C. He used to be a marine biologist and a commercial diver.
